name: New York's cool new park in the sky
description: Hovering above Manhattan's West Side on a formerly abandoned elevated railroad is an aerial park that has become one of New York City's top attractions. More Info

name: Early bloom
description: The High Line's plant list includes giant pussy willow. This and other plants were blooming ahead of schedule due to an unusually mild winter.

name: Tracks
description: Throughout the High Line are carefully-preserved remnants of its history as a rail corridor. Plantings and fixtures are closely integrated with tracks and cross-ties.

name: Diagonal
description: Concrete planks taper into planted areas; the designers' goal was to blur the edges between pavement and plantings.

name: 10th Avenue Square
description: Tenth Avenue Square is suspended directly above the street. The amphitheater-like space lets visitors descend into the structure and gaze through plate glass windows at the the traffic below.

name: Loungers
description: On an early spring weekday most of the prime spots were occupied. Competition is intense on warm weekend afternoons.

name: Underpass
description: A chic new Standard Hotel looms above the southern end of the High Line. The building is among the most visible signs of the ongoing transformation of the Meatpacking District from industrial to upscale.
address: 47 Little W 12th Street, New York, NY 10014

name: High Line sign
description: The broadleaf symbol of the New York City Parks and Recreation Department gives evidence to the High Line's official status as a city park.

name: Goodbye
description: The amateur photographer seen snapping a picture of his companion earlier in this story waves farewell at the southern terminus of the High Line.
